export
Interface ExportInterface

All Known Implementing Classes:
ExportEagle, ExportEPS, ExportFidoCad, ExportPDF, ExportPGF, ExportSVG
public interface ExportInterface

ExportInterface.java Interface which allows to export a FidoCad draw under an arbitrary format. The primitive handling system of FidoCadJ will call each primitive export function and provide every informations about the primitive state. Each coordinate is given in FidoCadJ coordinate space, which means that normally one unit corresponds to 5 mils (127 microns). I do not consider the export phase as a speed sensitive context. For this reason, I try to write that interface in order to achieve the maximum ease of use of the various parameters involving each primitive. 


   Version History 

Version         Date            Author      Remarks
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1.0             June  2008      D. Bucci   First working version

Method Detail

exportStart

void exportStart(java.awt.Dimension totalSize,
                 java.util.Vector la,
                 int grid)
                 throws java.io.IOException
Called at the beginning of the export phase. Ideally, in this routine there should be the code to write the header of the file on which the drawing should be exported.

Parameters:
totalSize - the size of the image. Useful to calculate for example the bounding box.
layerV - a LayerDesc vector describing the attributes of each layer.
grid - the grid size
Throws:
java.io.IOException

void exportEnd()
               throws java.io.IOException
Called at the end of the export phase.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

exportAdvText

void exportAdvText(int x,
                   int y,
                   int sizex,
                   int sizey,
                   java.lang.String fontname,
                   boolean isBold,
                   boolean isMirrored,
                   boolean isItalic,
                   int orientation,
                   int layer,
                   java.lang.String text)
                   throws java.io.IOException
Called when exporting an Advanced Text primitive.

Parameters:
x - the x position of the beginning of the string to be written
y - the y position of the beginning of the string to be written
sizex - the x size of the font to be used
sizey - the y size of the font to be used
fontname - the font to be used
isBold - true if the text should be written with a boldface font
isMirrored - true if the text should be mirrored
isItalic - true if the text should be written with an italic font
orientation - angle of orientation (degrees)
layer - the layer that should be used
text - the text that should be written
Throws:
java.io.IOException

exportBezier

void exportBezier(int x1,
                  int y1,
                  int x2,
                  int y2,
                  int x3,
                  int y3,
                  int x4,
                  int y4,
                  int layer,
                  boolean arrowStart,
                  boolean arrowEnd,
                  int arrowStyle,
                  int arrowLength,
                  int arrowHalfWidth,
                  int dashStyle)
                  throws java.io.IOException
Called when exporting a Bézier primitive.

Parameters:
x1 - the x position of the first point of the trace
y1 - the y position of the first point of the trace
x2 - the x position of the second point of the trace
y2 - the y position of the second point of the trace
x3 - the x position of the third point of the trace
y3 - the y position of the third point of the trace
x4 - the x position of the fourth point of the trace
y4 - the y position of the fourth point of the trace
layer - the layer that should be used // from 0.22.1
arrowStart - specify if an arrow is present at the first point
arrowEnd - specify if an arrow is present at the second point
arrowLength - total lenght of arrows (if present)
arrowHalfWidth - half width of arrows (if present)
dashStyle - dashing style
Throws:
java.io.IOException

exportMacro

boolean exportMacro(int x,
                    int y,
                    boolean isMirrored,
                    int orientation,
                    java.lang.String macroName,
                    java.lang.String macroDesc,
                    java.lang.String name,
                    int xn,
                    int yn,
                    java.lang.String value,
                    int xv,
                    int yv,
                    java.lang.String font,
                    java.util.Map m)
                    throws java.io.IOException
Called when exporting a Macro call. This function can just return false, to indicate that the macro should be rendered by means of calling the other primitives. Please note that a macro does not have a reference layer, since it is defined by its components.

Parameters:
x - the x position of the position of the macro
y - the y position of the position of the macro
isMirrored - true if the macro is mirrored
orientation - the macro orientation in degrees
macroName - the macro name
macroDesc - the macro description, in the FidoCad format
name - the shown name
xn - coordinate of the shown name
yn - coordinate of the shown name
value - the shown value
xv - coordinate of the shown value
yv - coordinate of the shown value
font - the used font
m - the library
Throws:
java.io.IOException

exportOval

void exportOval(int x1,
                int y1,
                int x2,
                int y2,
                boolean isFilled,
                int layer,
                int dashStyle)
                throws java.io.IOException
Called when exporting an Oval primitive. Specify the bounding box.

Parameters:
x1 - the x position of the first corner
y1 - the y position of the first corner
x2 - the x position of the second corner
y2 - the y position of the second corner
isFilled - it is true if the oval should be filled
layer - the layer that should be used
dashStyle - dashing style
Throws:
java.io.IOException

exportPCBPad

void exportPCBPad(int x,
                  int y,
                  int style,
                  int six,
                  int siy,
                  int indiam,
                  int layer,
                  boolean onlyHole)
                  throws java.io.IOException
Called when exporting a PCBPad primitive.

Parameters:
x - the x position of the pad
y - the y position of the pad
style - the style of the pad (0: oval, 1: square, 2: rounded square)
six - the x size of the pad
siy - the y size of the pad
indiam - the hole internal diameter
layer - the layer that should be used
Throws:
java.io.IOException

Called when exporting a Polygon primitive

isFilled - true if the polygon is filled
layer - the layer that should be used
dashStyle - dashing style
Throws:
java.io.IOException
